languages.text: "Вы... прикоснулись к тому, чего касаться совсем не следовало". {n}Хранитель складывает руки на груди и осудительно качает головой.{/n} "Дитя" — так служители станции зовут госпожу Кассию, ибо негоже грязным ртам простолюдинов произносить ее имя. Видите ли, не всей прислуге стоит купировать органы голосового аппарата. Некоторые оказываются полезнее, пока все еще способны говорить".

traits.locale_text: "Вы... прикоснулись к тому, чего касаться совсем не следовало". {n}Хранитель складывает руки на груди и осудительно качает головой.{/n} "Дитя" — так служители станции зовут госпожу Кассию, ибо негоже рязным ртам простолюдинов произносить ее имя. Видите ли, не всей прислуге стоит купировать ограны голосового аппарата. Некоторые оказываются полезнее, пока все еще способны говорить".

languages.text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."
languages.original_text: "Вы... прикоснулись к тому, чего касаться совсем не следовало". {n}Хранитель складывает руки на груди и осудительно качает головой.{/n} "Дитя" — так служители станции зовут госпожу Кассию, ибо негоже грязным ртам простолюдинов произносить ее имя. Видите ли, не всей прислуге стоит купировать органы голосового аппарата. Некоторые оказываются полезнее, пока все еще способны говорить".

traits.locale_text: "You... touched upon something that should not have been touched at all." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "The Child" is what the station's servants call mistress Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name. You see, not all servants should have their vocal apparatus organs docked. Some prove to be useful while still able to speak."

"You... touched upon something that should not have been touched at all." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "The Child" is what the station's servants call mistress Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name. You see, not all servants should have their vocal apparatus organs docked. Some prove to be useful while still able to speak."

"You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call mistress Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name. You see, not all servants should have their vocal apparatus organs altered. Some prove to be more useful while still able to speak."

"You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call mistress Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name. You see, not all servants should have their vocal apparatus organs altered. Some prove to be more useful while still able to speak."

"You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

"You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

languages.text: "Ihr ... habt Euch in etwas eingemischt, was niemand hätte anrühren dürfen." {n}Der Hüter verschränkt die Arme und schüttelt missbilligend den Kopf.{/n} "'Das Kind', so nennen die Diener der Station Lady Cassia, denn die dreckigen Mäuler des Pöbels dürfen ihren Namen nicht beschmutzen, indem sie ihn aussprechen. Ihr müsst wissen, es ist nicht für alle Diener von Vorteil, wenn ihre Sprechorgane manipuliert werden. Manche erweisen sich als nützlicher, wenn sie des Sprechens noch fähig sind."
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: "Ihr ... habt Euch in etwas eingemischt, was niemand hätte anrühern dürfen." {n}Der Hüter verschränkt die Arme und schüttelt missbilligend den Kopf.{/n} "'Das Kind', so nennen die Diener der Station Herrin Cassia, denn die dreckigen Mäuler des Pöbels dürfen ihren Namen nicht beschmutzen. Wisst Ihr, nicht bei allen Dienern sollten die Organe des Stimmapparats verändert werden. Manche erweisen sich als nützlicher, wenn sie des Sprechens noch fähig sind."

languages.text: « Vous n'auriez pas dû fourrer votre nez là-dedans. » {n}Le gardien croise les bras et secoue la tête d'un air désapprobateur.{/n} « "L'Enfant", c'est le nom que les serviteurs de la station donnent à dame Cassia, car les bouches impures des roturiers ne doivent pas souiller son nom en le prononçant. Vous voyez, ce n'est pas toujours une bonne chose que d'altérer les organes vocaux des serviteurs. Certains s'avèrent plus utiles quand ils peuvent encore parler. »
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: « Vous n'auriez pas dû fourrer votre nez là-dedans. » {n}Le gardien croise les bras et secoue la tête d'un air désapprobateur.{/n} « "L'Enfant", c'est le nom que les serviteurs de la station donnent à maîtresse Cassia, car les bouches impures des roturiers ne doivent pas souiller son nom. Vous voyez, il n'est pas nécessaire d'altérer les organes vocaux de tous les serviteurs. Certains s'avèrent plus utiles quand ils peuvent encore parler. »

languages.text: “您……您插手了本不该插手的事情。”{n}费雷克交叉双臂，不满地摇了摇头。{/n}“这座星站里所有的仆人，都会用‘圣子’来称呼卡西娅女士，因为她的圣名决不能被普通人的称呼玷污。如您所见，如果把所有仆人的声带都进行改造，那恐怕并不是什么明智之举。有些仆人需要保留说话能力，才能发挥更大作用。”
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: “您……您插手了本不该插手的事情。”{n}费雷克交叉双臂，不满地摇了摇头。{/n}“这座星站里所有的仆人，都会用‘圣子’来称呼卡西娅女主人，因为她的圣名决不能被普通人的称呼玷污。如您所见，并非所有仆人的声带都进行过改造。有些仆人需要保留说话能力，才能发挥更大作用。”

languages.text: 「あなたは…触れてはいけないものに触れた」{n}保持者は腕を組んで、やれやれと首を横に振った。{/n}「『御子』とは、ステーションの従者が使うカシア様の呼び名だ。庶民の汚い口で彼女の名前を汚せないからな。ほら、すべての従者が発声装置器官を改造するのは有益ではない。まだ声が出せる方が使える者もいるだろう」
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: 「あなたは…触れてはいけないものに手を出した」{n}管理人は腕を組んで、やれやれと首を横に振った。{/n} 「『御子』とは、ステーションの従者が使うカシア様の呼び名だ。庶民の汚い口で彼女の名前を汚せないからな。ほら、すべての従者が発声装置器官を改造するのは有益ではない。まだ声が出せる方が利用できると思える者もいるだろう」
「あなたは…触れてはいけないものに触れた」{n}保持者は腕を組んで、やれやれと首を横に振った。{/n}「『御子』とは、ステーションの従者が使うカシア様の呼び名だ。庶民の汚い口で彼女の名前を汚せないからな。ほら、すべての従者が発声装置器官を改造するのは有益ではない。まだ声が出せる方が使える者もいるだろう」

languages.text: «Se... ha entrometido en algo que debería haber dejado estar». {n}El guardián se cruza de brazos y niega con la cabeza a modo de reproche.{/n} «"La Niña" es el nombre con el que los sirvientes de la estación se refieren a lady Cassia, puesto que su nombre no debe ser mancillado por las sucias bocas de la plebe al pronunciarlo. Verá, no resulta práctico alterar los órganos vocales de todos los sirvientes. Algunos son más útiles si todavía son capaces de hablar».
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: «Se... ha entrometido en algo que debería haber dejado estar». {n}El guardián se cruza de brazos y niega con la cabeza a modo de reproche.{/n} «"La Niña" es el nombre con el que los sirvientes de la estación se refieren a nuestra señora Cassia, puesto que su nombre no debe ser mancillado por las sucias bocas de la plebe. Verá, no alteramos los órganos vocales de todos los sirvientes. Algunos son más útiles si todavía son capaces de hablar».

languages.text: "Bak şimdi... En olmayacak şeyi kurcalamışsın." {n}Sorumlu, kollarını kavuşturup onaylamaz bir tavırla başını sallıyor.{/n} "İstasyon hizmetkârları, Leydi Cassia'ya 'Çocuk' der. Zira avam takımı, onun adını pis ağızlarına alarak kirletmemelidir. E tahmin edersin ki hizmetkârların dilini kesmek de işimize pek gelmiyor. Bazıları konuşabildiklerinde daha yararlı oluyorlar."
languages.original_text: "You... meddled with something that should have been left alone." {n}The Keeper folds his arms and shakes his head disapprovingly.{/n} "'The Child' is what the station's servants call Lady Cassia, for the commoners' dirty mouths must not sully her name by uttering it. You see, it is not beneficial for all servants to have their vocal organs altered. Some prove to be more useful when they are still able to speak."

traits.locale_text: "Bak şimdi... En olmayacak şeyi kurcalamışsın." {n}Sorumlu, kollarını kavuşturup onaylamaz bir tavırla başını sallıyor.{/n} "İstasyon hizmetkârları, Leydi Cassia'ya 'Çocuk' der. Zira avam takımı, onun adını pis ağızlarına alarak kirletmemelidir. E tahmin edersin ki hizmetkârların dilini kesmek de işimize pek gelmiyor. Bazıları konuşabildiklerinde daha yararlı oluyorlar."
